definitions: To be a place that a person visits often.
To be persistently present in (the mind of someone) as a memory, idea, or feeling.
To appear as a ghost or spirit in (a place).
examples: He used to haunt that pub every Friday night.
The old house is said to be haunted by a grey lady.
Memories of the accident continued to haunt him.
The idea of failure began to haunt her thoughts.
